messages.message:
ITProPortal: Docker support is being deprecated in Kubernetes, but not completely.
https://www.itproportal.com/news/docker-support-is-being-deprecated-in-kubernetes-but-not-just-yet/ (https://www.itproportal.com/news/docker-support-is-being-deprecated-in-kubernetes-but-not-just-yet/)

tl;dr

Docker is not complaint with CRI (standard of K8s (https://kubernetes.io/blog/2016/12/container-runtime-interface-cri-in-kubernetes/)) but being the most popular container solution out there K8s community had to develop a workaround called `dockershim` and this module is being deprecated (as of 1.20) due to maintenance issues and will be removed by v1.23. Removal of this module will also end the support for docker runtime.

The good news is - images build using docker will continue to run as always (as far as images and runtime are OCI compliant (https://opencontainers.org/)) and hopefully most of the end-users of K8s should not face any difficulties.
